fetch.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to go and get something or someone and bring them back
fetch.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Quick! Go and fetch a doctor.
Shannon went upstairs to fetch some blankets.
Would you mind going to fetch the kids from school?
Fetch me some coffee while you’re up.
fetch somebody something/fetch something for somebody
fetch.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to be sold for a particular amount of money, especially at a public sale – used especially in news reports
fetch.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The painting is expected to fetch at least $20 million.
fetch.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to make people react in a particular way
fetch.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: This announcement fetched a huge cheer from the audience.
